Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Gunning \Gun"ning\, n. The act or practice of hunting or shooting game with a gun. [1913 Webster]
The art of gunning was but little practiced. --Goldsmith.

gun n 1: a weapon that discharges a missile at high velocity (especially from a metal tube or barrel) 2: large but transportable armament [syn: {artillery}, {heavy weapon}, {ordnance}] 3: a person who shoots a gun (as regards their ability) [syn: {gunman}] 4: a professional killer who uses a gun [syn: {gunman}, {gunslinger}, {hired gun}, {gun for hire}, {triggerman}, {hit man}, {hitman}, {torpedo}, {shooter}] 5: a hand-operated pump that resembles a gun; forces grease into parts of a machine [syn: {grease-gun}] 6: a pedal that controls the throttle valve; "he stepped on the gas" [syn: {accelerator}, {accelerator pedal}, {gas pedal}, {gas}, {throttle}] 7: the discharge of a gun as signal or as a salute in military ceremonies; "a twenty gun salute" v : shoot with a gun [also: {gunning}, {gunned}]
